alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 4:12PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Johnson and northwestern Muscatine Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 412 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nichols, or 11 miles southeast of West Branch, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Nichols around 420 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lone Tree. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
